Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: KP15
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel before check-in and the receptionist told us that we could leave our bags behind reception so that we could go off and explore the city. When we finally checked in (which was very straightforward) we went to our room. This was a basic 4 bed room (for a group of 4 of us). The decor was a bit tired but it certainly served it's purpose for us as we didn't spend much time there. The room was cleaned the next morning, and we were given fresh towels. I would only recommend this room for a group of friends or someone travelling who is on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but very small”
Reviews.Author: phoebew851
Reviews.Content: check in only after 2pm, but you can leave your bags at reception & don't forget city tax to pay. Room is clean enough, very small as the bed filled the room! hot shower, cold radiators (trip April 2012 - very cold wind outside & have would be nice to come back to a warm room) steep stairs to 2nd floor, but has all you need for a few nights stay, they change your towels every day :o) - tram 2 takes you to Dam square in 14 mins - best to get a 24 hour tram ticket - cheaper than buying each trip - hotel has a good breakfast service (continental - but eggs available and lovely fresh bread, great trip, great city, tried to do all the main attractions but time ran out (ps. pre book your museum's etc as you will have to queue some time to get in)

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel but nice enough”
Reviews.Author: kiwisinl0nd0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over New Years 2011-2012. The room was the best value hotel that we could locate (location and standard Vs price). The rooms were basic, but contained everything we needed. The only issue was the lack of heating. We had a radiator in the room however only one small section of the heater was working. We asked reception for a small fan heater however we were told that all heaters were in the basement and not available for use. For this reason we were forced to sleep in thermals - so perhaps only stay here in summer. It is around a 20 minute walk to Dam square, with Museum district being 12 minute walk. The hotel is also right by a tram stop, so one train, and one tram from the airport to the hotel. Even in the dark it was easy to locate this hotel. In terms of location this residential area is perfect for a bit of quiet while still being close to all the action. We did not get breakfast based on other reviews on here. We were glad as it looked very basic and there are plenty of good cafes on the way into town which work out cheaper for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, steep stairs”
Reviews.Author: gypsicsoul
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really small and the stairs leading up to them were steep enough for us to be scared to drag our bags over (or worse, try and pick them). But that's a problem with most Amsterdam hotels. The bathrooms were really small, smaller than the ones in New York Times Square hotels. The room also had a lingering wet smell which didn't go away for the two days that we were there. Our friends had a room on the ground floor which was better. We booked this place for the lack of availability of anything else in the centre. Must say that the hotel was very well located and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Layaan A
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, a great hotel. Clean, warm, quiet, comfy beds and a good shower. That is all i expect from a hotel at this price. Located in an expensive area, Vondle park is very close and a very nice park. Tram stop just outside the hotel takes you straight into the centre. WARNING-Do not pay for the hotel shuttle bus from the airport 16 euros. The train to central station is 4 euro and 2 Euro on the tram to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a sick joke.”
Reviews.Author: Lauren A
Reviews.Content: I cannot actually believe the amount of amazing reviews this place has, I cannot believe that this is the same place that my friend and I have just had the displeasure to stay in. From the start we were given a room on the top floor which required mountaineering expertise to climb the steep stairs with heavy luggage. As two young girls we were not offered any assistance and as a result I ended up with numerous bruises on my leg from the struggle. Our room was clean and overall on first inspection I was very satisfied, until we opened the patio doors and realised that they were rather difficult to close. The first night we were awoken to the sound of heavy wind rushing throughout the room, I thought someone had intruded but in actual fact it was the patio doors that had given in to the forces of the January winds. On the first morning we attempted to have a shower however there was no water flow, we tried to call down to the reception but the phone line was dead. We abseiled down the cliff (stairs) and told the staff of our problems, they said they could ring to our room no problem and that they would have a look at the shower. That evening when we returned to have a shower before hitting the bars we were bemused to find that the shower had not been fixed, so we again went to reception and told the staff, who then rang up her colleague and found out that he had 'forgot' to fix the shower. She offered us a free breakfast and to use the communal shower at the reception, however we had paid for en suite facilities not hostel communal facilities. Returning to our room another member of staff came with a new shower which worked perfectly for the duration of our stay. (The phone still did not work from our room) The rest of the stay was okay, apart from the lack of sleep due to feather pillows but that is down to preference and loud Russian people shouting at 3am. However, on the last night the apple inn dealt its final blow, by locking our room due to "damage of a towel" this towel had been used to wipe half a cup of Latte coffee that had been spilt previously. The staff then had the audacity to charge us 15 euro for this 'damage' and said that their maid was a 'professional' and could not use this towel again. Hearing this nonsense I asked if I was able to take it to the launderettes personally as I refused to be charged 15 euro for a coffee stain that could be easily washed out. Which of course it was, for roughly 4 euro at a nearby (10 minutes walk) launderette. The staff then replied that their maid had 'not tired hard enough' to remove the stain, which in reality meant that she had not washed it at all as it still smelt of damp and coffee. They then removed the charge as the towel was fresh as a daisy after a nice wash in the washing machine. Personally, being young females I think this was just a ploy to try scare us into paying the charge without questioning their authority, on reflection I should not have spent my own money cleaning a towel which should have been included in their services. Be warned it is a scam to earn extra money! And do not indulge in any mud wrestling activities as you will be charged for any dirt mark on your towels... such a joke. Overall, Amsterdam was an amazing experience and loved spending the start of my new year in the city, however this hotel has a lot of explaining to do on the treatment of customers. P.S. I would advise you to take your own towels. And maybe some new patio doors...

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollingee
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8-11 Nov room ok,clean,staff helpful,didnt bother with breakfast though.You can get breakfast cheaper in the city.Tram 2 stops 2 minutes walk away,get off at Valursplein. We bought the 4 day tram ticket for 19.50 euros each which is neccessary because station/centre to hotel is too far to walk

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cara031
Reviews.Content: We have just visited this hotel for 3 nights. Had a great time. Staff were very helpful & room was clean with very comfy beds !! Location was in a quiet area but trams go past the hotel every few minutes. After reading some of the reviews people had left, I wasn't expecting it to be so good. Will definitely be going back !!!

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: lindale
Reviews.Content: Our room, which could sleep 4 gave us space â€“ including an outdoor seating on decking in the garden, but it had a miniscule wardrobe and nowhere to put clothes or other items. It had an en-suite wet room, with a tiny sink and a toilet you either sat on sideways or risked knocking yourself out on the wall.The shower was excellent having plenty of hot water with a good pressure. The position of the room on the ground floor meant it suffered from the noise of other guests entering/leaving the hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean â€“ if very basic. I guess that other rooms on different floors have their good & bad points. On the plus side all the breakfast room was very nice and the Dutch breakfast plenty and filling. We were very impressed with the staff at The Apple Inn, who were very friendly. When we arrived they provided an extra lamp for our room and later willingly loaned umbrellas when it rained. Well done and thank you staff! We like the location of the Hotel â€“ away from the busy centre near Vondal Park, but with a number 2 tram stop at the front and a number 16 to the rear, meaning easy access to the centre. Finding a decent hotel at a good price in Amsterdam is difficult, although The Apple Inn is a bit basic we would certainly consider staying again. Tip: If you want to make the most of your time in Amsterdam buy an â€œI Amsterdam cardâ€�, to use public transport and visit museums etc! We had a 3 day card which had paid for itself by the end of day 1!

Reviews.Title: “Apple Inn Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Paulinesussex
Reviews.Content: Arrived back today from 3 days in amsterdam staying at the Apple Inn Hotel, was a bit dubious after reading some of the reviews, but glad I booked. The hotel was lovely, staff very friendly, advised and answered all our questions.. The hotel was clean, the room was cleaned each day, clean sheets and towels which surprised me as we were only staying a couple of nights. Only draw back was the stairs, the usual dutch stairways steep and narrow, so we had to drag the cases up and our grandaughter , would have been nice if hotel staff had helped, but hey it is a two star. Hotel is situated just outside the mainstrip , there is a tram no 2 that takes you to and from main station about 10 -15 mins, although we walked quite a bit to the centre. wouldnt hesitate to go back again.,

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cheap”
Reviews.Author: EcosseJD
Reviews.Content: Located out of city centre, but trams only a 2 minute walk. Our room was adjacent to reception so no steeps stairs to carry luggage up. Linen and towels changed frequently, but had to use showers on maximum temperature to shower down bathroom to remove funny smell. Reception staff helpful. Breakfast was continental (9.5 euros) had meats but staff had to be reminded about boiled eggs. Also choice of preserves was at times limited as they had not had time to visit the wholesalers! Reception staff informed us that breakfast was nothing to do with them! Radiator in room was either very hot or off. As we had only paid Â£250 each for 7 nights B&B including flights, it represented good value as the room was only for sleeping as Amsterdam has many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok - very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights after finding the hotel through a hotel voucher site. From reading the mixed reviews and photos we were unsure of what to expect, but the photos do flatter the hotel a little. Despite the nearby tram line being closed for maintenance and therefore having to trek with luggage for 20 minutes, we arrived well before check-in time - we were though allowed to check-in and received some very helpful directions and maps from the gentleman at reception. The interior of the hotel was very basic and the stairs to our room were very steep. The room was clean and functional, but offered little other than a bed. Breakfast was a self-service continental and was a pleasant start to the day, although there seemed to no hot water available for a morning brew, as the water heater was only tepid. The hotel is quite a long way from the main city centre area and trams and buses had to be used to reduce journey times. It is though close to the very attractive Vondelpark and Museum Quarter and so nestles in a very plesant and seemingly wealthy area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hernandez j
Reviews.Content: I have spent 2 over nights in APPLE INN Amsterdam and have to say that i really enjoyed it. Breakfast is the most important moment of the day, and for a 2 stars hotel, it is a 4 stars breakfast just to let you know. More than that, the entire staff there including the hotel Director Dimitri is taking care of you since day 1. I strongly recommend to stay into this hotel to discover Amsterdam and enjoy a great morning breakfast start!!

Reviews.Title: “Apple Inn is overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna N
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely not worth the money! We have paid exactly the same price for 2 nights in Paris city center and I feel french hotel standards were much better. The receptionist at Apple inn is rude and doesn't smile at all. We couldn't go to our room until 2pm because it was being cleaned, only to find someone's hair on our pillows when we got in! Would not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “nasty”
Reviews.Author: titania19792000
Reviews.Content: nasty bed, chair, carpet and balcony.... I can't believe that this is a two star hotel. NNNNNNNNNNNNaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaasssssssssssssssssstttttttttttttttttttyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy

Reviews.Title: “No redeeming qualities”
Reviews.Author: Agent424
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was booked and confirmed well in advance but they have different e-mails and claim mail is not received so they can charge for extra nights. When you check out the receptionist takes 7 Euro for the Taxi stating the taxi will discount the fare by this amount but you end up paying full fare. There is a stair way to the upper rooms which is absolutely dangerous, mold in rooms, broken tile on the floors......Between the bad service, scams and disfunctional building it was survival not an enjoyable stay. I travel frequently through Africa and this hotel would be an embarassment in the African cities where I travel.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Lua13london
Reviews.Content: hotel is not that far away from the central, easy accesible via park, which i really pretty. just take a tram 2 and you'll in central within 15mins. area is quiet n nice. i always say the 1st impression is the most important. when we came to check in, the receptionist didn't acknowledge us at all. we thought she was simply busy, even though she could at least say hi as we were 5 of us!!! we were standing there literally for 5mins and no signs of asking us anything. so we just say hi, she replied - nothing else. then we said we were checking in and that was the time when she actually start doing something. i think that was a terrible start. then there was a payment problem and the breakfast charge confusion, so not the best check in ever. plus she didn't smile or nothing. we were not impressed. then she walked us to the room. the housekeeping were cleaning the other rooms still and there were bags everywhere. the floor was cracked, walls paint falling off. i was actually scared to walk in to the room. to be honest we were surprised. the room was big, it was for 5 people and seemed nice. the furniture was very old, there was radio from 1923 (i think). old tv but worked. the remote control battery flat, bathroom cleaned, however the bathroom bin had still some blood on it and no one cleaned it for another 2 nights we were staying there. breakfast - basic. bread, cheese, ham, jams, nuttella, biscuits and boiled eggs. choise of cereals, juices and hot drinks. i'm a vegetarian so not much to eat for me but it was really good though. staff was friendly, even though too slow with topping up the buffet, even though it wasn't busy there at all. we were using the hotel to only for sleeping so it served the purpose but wouldn't stay there for a longer period. average hotel that needs to improve with customer service (expecially that receptionist)

Reviews.Title: “If you want luxury, pay for it”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbellsfollower
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded expectation after all the less than flattering comments. Agreed, it might have needed a fresh lick of paint and the bedroom was an odd shade of browny beige BUT really, all we needed the room for was to sleep in after seeing the sights. The bed sheets were clean, we had the beds made and fresh towels on the morning of our last night there and the beds were comfy. Bathroom was basic but again, clean and did what it needed to do! We had a ground floor room, with the window on the street - we were interrupted the first night by talking outside but you couldn't hear anything when the window was closed. Its in a great location, just off tram route 2 (2 mins walk from the stp, 10-15 mins tram ride to the centre) and you would pay much, much more to be closer. As long as you're not expecting high luxury - especially if you haven't paid for it - it's fine. I would certainly not put people off staying. Didn't try the breakfast but there was a long list of items available. Just go with it, don't be too precious and enjoy the city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful days in Amsterdam and Apple Inn”
Reviews.Author: Veska
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed Apple Inn hotel for a week. It has good location in a nice area of the city, very near to a tram line. The rooms are clean and cosy. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We recommend Apple Inn for a pleasant trip in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely, pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: Caitlinjane
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews of this hotel on here, I was quite apprehensive about the hotel, however what we found when we arrived was lovely, functional and clean. It is not the most grand hotel in the world however our rooms were very light and airy. The staff are really friendly and helpful, and the only criticism I have of this hotel is that it is quite far from the centre in a residential area, and taxis cost around â‚¬12 to get into town.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: HLH_82
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about this place having read other reviews on here however was pleasantly surprised. The room was big enough for me and my 2 friends and was comfortable even with a little balcony. The furniture and bedding is probably a little dated but was clean and the bathroom was immaculate. Customer service was really good - 24 horu reception staff were on hand with tips and advice. It's also not a million miles from the city centre as other reviews would lead you to believe. The museums are about a 10 minute walk down one road and another 5 minutes will get you to Leidseplein where a lot of the nightlife is. A taxi further into town would set you back about â‚¬15 which is fine if there is more than one of you. Otherwise tram stops almost at the door. It's basic - but at Â£20 per night it's excellent value for money and would definitely reccommend for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCV83
Reviews.Content: I was slightly concerned after reading some bad reviews on here about Hotel Apple Inn but I am pleased to say there was no reason to worry. I traveled with 2 friends and we booked a triple room for the weekend. The room was very spacious and had it's own Balcony and en suite. The accommodation is basic but has everything you need for a short city break. All of the staff were very helpful and gave us lots of information on good places to go out, where to eat, transport links etc. The location is much quieter than more central hotels which was great and its only a 10 minute walk to Leidesplein with lots of cafes, bars clubs. There is also a tramline outside the hotel that takes you right to Dam square. I'd definitely stay again and would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very bad”
Reviews.Author: edwards_11
Reviews.Content: i went to this hotel on the 25th of feb,after booking it through late rooms.com,i booked a room for 5 as it stated they had this avalible on there web site,when calling the hotel 2days before arriving to make sure everything was ok i was then informed that they did not have the room i had booked avalible,and we had bin split into 2 rooms,when arriving at the hotel we were met by a man called christian who was very rude,after booking us in which took forever as the people who work here clearly dont communicate with each,after showing us to our room and discovering he had to add another bed,he then turnt to us and said he,d rather we all just left as he couldnt be botherd with us,then once we were setteled we decided we would have a hot drink discovering there were no tea/coffee facilities in our room,went to reception to ask were to get this,he then rudely said they dont do tea just coffee and it was 2euros,it states its 10mins away from center,more like 20mins and thats by taxi,would not recommend this hotel at all to anyone,although christan was rude there is a nice man called ryan than works there,but honestly realy not worth puttin urself through the stress,

Reviews.Title: “More information on check in!”
Reviews.Author: Amaland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2010 with a friend and I was very disappointed. Our flight arrived early and I was glad we could leave our bags in reception and go have a bite to eat but when we got back we were told that our double room was ready. We had requested a twin. The receptionist insisted we had booked a double until I produced my confirmation. Bunking in for 1 night may have been ok but we were staying longer than that. There is no lift in this hotel and we had to carry our luggage up a steep staircase which curved and narrowed at the top. Our room was next to the stairs and you could hear everyone coming and going, including the partying in other rooms. The rooms were small but the bathroom (wet room) was clean. Our beds may as well have been a double they were that close together. A little more information about the area on check in would have been much appreciated. We only discovered how the metro worked on our last day and as we walked everywhere that would have meant more museums to visit!! We never ate in the hotel.. didnt even know where the dining room was as we were never told!

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Apple”
Reviews.Author: london65-10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 day's. Room was tiny, bed was 2 feet from wall and we had to move chair everytime we passed . We had to ask for clean towels and our room was not cleaned during our stay. I have health and safety issues with the room at top of hotel. This place is more of a bad hostel than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep 2 for each room only!”
Reviews.Author: ventofreddo
Reviews.Content: We booked a quadruple room but it consisted in a double one with 2 added beds with the result that spaces were absolutely inadequate. Walking in the room was almost impossible such as opening windows. Baggages had to be left on the floor behind the entrance room. Sleeping 2 would be more pleasant as the room itself hasn't particular defects. Bathroom is tiny but well equipped. Hotel is located in a residential area of the city, about 10mins away from the city center using tram no. 2. Museum area is at walking distance, with a 15mins stroll. Arriving from Schipol is quite fast both via Centraal Station (train + tram no. 2) and Zuid Station (train + tram no. 5 + 16 or 2). Breakfast is in the average, mostly with cold foods. Biscuits, jams, pies, ham, etc. are tasty and the choice is wide enough.

Reviews.Title: “Try and find somewhere else - its not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: MissBree
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Amsterdam with some friends for a birthday. The rooms which we had pre booked - 1 twin bed, 1 triple - was changed by the staff to one double room with a double bed (I had to share with my pregnant friend), and a triple. They insisted on us paying fully for our rooms, and then they told us about the change in our original reservation. The Isreali man at the desk was very rude, and unapologetic. Our room was small, the towels were grey, and the sheets were not clean. We had two dreadful nights sleep as you can hear everything with people running up and down the stairs, babies crying. The location was good, but really - there has to be better places to stay - in such a beautiful city,

Reviews.Title: “Run as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: why2506
Reviews.Content: Hotel is dirty, sheets stained with sweat where cleaning will not remove. Pillows have ,brown stains-blood? (room 29). Bathrooms not cleaned daily, just toilet paper replaced. Wet room, shower drain smells, not cleaned daily. Bugs in rooms (40). Serge manager, very unprofessional. Feels this is only a two star hotel and they do not have extras nor should we expect anything but a low 2 star hotel, as stated by serge in a scream up the stairs. Kristy does best she can to deal with customers. Customers at check out claiming that passport was stolen, another stating that money was stolen, Kristy left to deal with as Serge hides. Hotel resently purchased by russians, obviously no previous hotel experience. Don't let them learn with you. Risks are high - expectations should be zero.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing and expensive”
Reviews.Author: littlecheese
Reviews.Content: Tiny, tatty room, tired decor, dodgy stains on the bed cover, bathroom in serious need of re-furbishment. Everything seriously worn and in need of re-doing. Breakfast was a good spread but all of it was cheap and flavourless. The staff were friendly enough but not in the least bit helpful. Plenty of hot water and in a nice area - Restaurant Bond just around the corner was terrific. They take school parties who are loud and boisterous at both ends of the day. Hostel accommodation at high hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rudakov1
Reviews.Content: good location, good breakfast, good service .... I liked this hotel

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: MoomsWien
Reviews.Content: Good location, quiet place with a number of beautiful parks, museums, and 5 minutes by tram to the historical center of Amsterdam is located in an elegant house built in the early twentieth century, beginning in the garden of the rooms on the first floor..Friendly staff,Wi-Fi.....

Reviews.Title: “if my car was there i would of slept in it.”
Reviews.Author: tdiddy22
Reviews.Content: My trip was great but this hotel should be crushed....Service was terrible, someone had used my restroom before i got into the room, the room smelled terrible also there was no toilet paper and when i asked the front desk for some they gave me a roll with less than half left on it from another restroom GROSS. i was awoke the next morning from a knock on the door from the front desk, asking was there anything i needed and i said yes toilet paper that was the last time i seen them walking around, you cant get online no remote for the tv , and the heater in my room didnt work..And i had a car come for me my last day to take me to the airport, and i told the front desk the night before to wake me at 9am never called to wake me up..... THIS HOTEL SUCKS I WOULD NOT RECOMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “never ever”
Reviews.Author: IAEHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May 09, when we were trying to find some hotel in AMS, we saw Apple Inn`s website and we thought that it is OK. but when we arrived to the hotel we understtod that we make a mistake. I will explain te results step by step. First reason is it is SO FAR AWAY THE CITY CENTER! If you wanna walk to the city center, you have to walk 2 hours. Generally ams has cold and rainy weather so you cannot walk easily. We use trams but they are not so cheap and also last tram is at 12.00 (24.00) so if you wanna go some club or cafe you have to leave there before 12.00. If you don`t do this you have to walk in cold night! Also we don`t like room. The bathroom and bath are really bad.. Breakfast is unsatisfied. AND ALSO HOTEL PERSONEL IS VERY RUDE! NOT LIKE THEM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever. . . .”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerEMEA
Reviews.Content: Well - this is not true! By searching my memory, I have experienced worse, but this was back in old Soviet Union and Ukraine before the Iron Curtain (1989) - even the color!! plate looks similar! The Apple-Inn, Amsterdam isnÂ´t even cheap for a 2-star hotel in Amsterdam. The beddings didnÂ´t look clean; it wasnÂ´t definitely not changed; Perhaps the room generally was clean but is was difficult to notice, as the hotel is worn-down and not renovated for years; staff going from un-friendly, unpolite to non-communicative; breakfast (EUR 22,-!!) was kindly spoken not an experience you want to remember (Hint: you can have breakfast buffet at the hotel opposite the street for EUR 17,-); there are no hangers in the room for your shirts/jacket etc.!; You are charged the full amount of the stay on the first day (even though you are going to stay a week!!. To be short - I will never go back! Life are too short for experiences like this!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever !!!!”
Reviews.Author: lala_boii
Reviews.Content: it was the worst hotel that i ever stayed in we booked it for 5 nights but checked out after 1 night and moved to a different hotel because it was so horrible it wasnt even a hotel it was a big old creepy house . when we booked it we were told it was few minutes walk to dam square but its about 3 hour . the staff were rude and the reception closes at 12 and trams stop at 12 and there are no shops really in walking distance there was no smoken in the rooms so if you want a smoking room you get a back garden were people can jump over the wall and in to your garden . it wasnt the cleanest we had to take the blankets off when we got in there first because they were wet. the hair dryer was cold air and was slow so couldnt use it . the shower can set off the fire alarm if the steam gets out and they charge you 350euro.. never again wolud i stay there..

Reviews.Title: “expensive sardine tin”
Reviews.Author: petebyrne
Reviews.Content: When I made this booking (thru TotalStay.co.uk) I was under the impression that I had booked Room & Breakfast NOT just room only - I never spotted that the booking was room only because that was NOT what I set out to do. I was convinced I was getting breakfast as part of the deal. I have to say that the hotel was a very big disappointment we were like sardines in the so called triple room. You could not sit properly on the toilet because of the lack of leg room in front of you - it was a joke to say the least. Fawlty Towers springs to mind. Based on what we got for our money I feel we were robbed - looking at other options you had we should have picked a proper 3 star hotel including breakfast and paid not much more than we did. We jhad to buy our breakfast each day & that cost probably exceeded the extra we would have paid in another BETTER hotel. They never made the beds one day on another day they had a half hearted attempt at making them - admittedly two of the beds crammed next to each other between 2 walls making the task very difficult. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeN
Reviews.Content: The location is great. I could either walk downtown or jump on the #2 tram, which was easy. I had a room at the back of the hotel, which is quieter than at the front due to the tram rail tracks. Problems were as follows: - The room was cold. The radiator was turned off when I arrived. I turned it on and barely got 17 degrees in the room. The last night, the temperature was 15 degrees. It was very cold. I mentionned it to the receptionnist who apologized but did not see fit to offer any compensation for the disagreement. One day, hotels will understand that when one buys a broken item from a store, one gets a discount. If something goes wrong during a hotel stay, guests should also be entitled to a discount. We should not need to ask for it, it should be automatic.

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: bb4040
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at the airport, which is the weiredest airport i've been too, went to connection travel and booked transfers 21 euro's for return, which dropped us off right out side the door. The hotel was clean bathrooms tiny but functional can't say was nice experience getting dressed and undressed in their, but went with a friend and not that familiar with each other so it was a shock to have to share a bed, beds really soft and comfy and the pillows were to die for, (tempted to bring it home). The hotel is situated about 3 tram stops from the van g mus, so quite near but not too near, overall had a fab time would go back again but only for 3 nights cause i've never walked so much in my life. Beware of those wishing to give directions when you look lost as they end with 'just one question for you' they are homeless and they want money

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Aussietriptraveller
Reviews.Content: Our room was small and the ensuite very mouldy. Breakfast was not very fresh. For example, new orange juice was just topped up in a dispenser - concentrate mixed with water. Not sure how old the juice at the bottom of the container was.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review. Good bits and bad bits.”
Reviews.Author: panda762
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Apple Inn from 9th â€“ 13th June. We booked via the Easyjet website, so shouldnâ€™t have been charged any extra on arrival. However, the receptionist insisted we pay 22 euros â€œtourist taxâ€� before sheâ€™d hand over the key! (We complained to Easyjet afterwards, who investigated and then credited our bank account with a refund). If this happens to you, I suggest you do the same! Trams are nearby and plentiful, so it was really easy to get about, and cheap. The Vondelpark is a short walk away. The key is simply a piece of plastic which you use to get back into the B&B once reception closes for the night. (Reception is not manned at night). It also allows you back into your room and allows you to turn the lights on. The room was peaceful (despite being right near to the breakfast room, which I imagined would wake us up in the mornings, however it was very quiet). Staff in the breakfast room appeared miserable, although there was usually a decent selection of food available. The view from the conservatory (adjoining the breakfast room) were of treetops, making us feel as if we were in a tree house (I liked that). The bed was extremely comfortable (Iâ€™d emailed them beforehand requesting a double bed, which is what we were allocated). The room was reasonably clean. The bathroom door did knock onto the bed when opened but we could still get in & out ok. Nice to have a table and chairs in the room, but there was a lack of cupboard space. The shower was a little tricky and we had to be careful not to flood the bathroom, however hot water was plentiful. No kettle in the room, or fridge, meant that we had to eat out most of the time, although we did bring back a few cold drinks and snacks. Yes, the stairs are steep, but most houses in Amsterdam have narrow stairways. Itâ€™s simply the way they were built. We managed ok but I wouldnâ€™t have wanted to carry too many cases upstairs (or try to get back up to the room after a little too much to drink!)

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: elaine_england
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Alpharooms.com after reading reviews on this site which all sounded quite good but after staying at this place I would not recommend this hotel to anyone with any kind of disabliity such as lymphoma, arthritus or heart trouble. The stairs were extremely steep and narrow and with no lift I was unable to get my case onto the second floor, fortunately I had help from another guest as no help was forthcoming from the staff. The room was very small and old fashioned with no safe or tea making facilities I couldn't wait to escape it! The shower was good but with no where to hang the shower head it was impossible to shower under. the door got stuck as soon as it was shut and it was hard to get out! The breakfast was a waste of time as we spent ages waiting for cups, knives etc no hot bacon and eggs or fresh croissants. I do not think that this hotel was very good value and will not be going back there .

Reviews.Title: “Not great...”
Reviews.Author: j13England
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a quadruple room. 3 of the beds were perfectly decent but the fourth may aswell have been a plank of wood put on the floor but with bumps in it, it was so uncomfortable. Not a lot of room for cases once four beds were stuffed into the room. Bathroom was tiny and the shower makes the entire floor wet. There is no lift and the stairs are incredibly steep and narrow so dragging suitcases up and down is not easy at all. The receptionist was very nice but at the end of our stay we were charged for phone calls that we didnt make. Also remember that city tax needs to be paid on top of the total cost of the rooms. Location is in a quiet area but there is a tram stop just up the road from the hotel which will take you to central station and goes past dam square- or this is about a 25 minute walk away approx.

Reviews.Title: “not great experience”
Reviews.Author: LondonGayle
Reviews.Content: While reading reviews of some hotel that i'm planning to book on our stay in bangkok, i remembered my unpleasant experience in apple inn hotel last year. stayed there for 3 nights. the rooms are not dirty but i wouldn't say it's clean either. bad smell in the toilet .no lift and the stairs are very steep. not recommended for elderly and if you have heavy luggage.unfriendly staff too and unreliable. almost missed our plane because of the stupidity of the lady in the reception at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better, could be worse”
Reviews.Author: Revelena
Reviews.Content: Spectacularly unhelpful staff -- but the room we had was cosy, relatively clean (don't look too close), and the hotel is in a really nice area near Vondelpark. There is no way you'd walk to the centre from here, but it's easy to catch the tram (#2) and it's worth the 10 min tram ride to be out of the city centre proper. Breakfast was perfectly decent (admittedly we were there very early, 7:30 am on a Sunday), nice dining room, lots of food, enough variety, no service -- but this also means nobody bothers you and you can have a pleasant meal before the start of the day. Overall probably overpriced for what it is, but I could find nothing else on short notice without a 2-3 night minimum stay (that wasn't a youth hostel), and was basically satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “A bit "crummy"”
Reviews.Author: n0rwegianw00d
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Apple Inn with two girlfriends for four nights. We should not all have shared one small room - it got extremely crowded. This was down to our own budget, though, so the hotel can't really be blamed. I learned from this that I should always put aside some money to be able to stay in my own room when traveling with girlfriends. My overall impression of the hotel was "a bit crummy". There were marks on the wall above one of the beds, and the bathroom was extremely tiny. You could not sit entirely face-forward on the toilet seat because the wall is so close. The woman at the reception seemed quite reserved and aloof at first, but turned out to be a nice and humorous girl. We didn't really feel like we were given a heartwarm welcome when we arrived, though. The stairs are very steep! And there are a LOT of them. We had to climb a flight of narrow stairs, then cross through the breakfast room before climbing even more narrow stairs to get to our little chamber, which caused some confusion, but as I've learned, a lot of the buildings in Amsterdam have these steep staircases and narrow halls. The breakfast buffet was OK.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in the apple inn”
Reviews.Author: CXLXAXIXRXE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from amsterdam our stay in the apple inn was great the rooms were clean, spacious and the hotel was in a nice area. Alot of the areas are seedy in amsterdam so it was nice to be staying in a more residential area. Although the hotel isn't near the main areas its easy to get the number 2 tram from central station to a stop just up from the hotel the stops called valeriusplein and there are other stops inbetween for dam square(red light district), leideisplein etc. All rooms come with breakfast and some rooms have balconys which you can sit out and smoke , and the hotel staff were always around cleaning rooms and fresh towels were given everyday. The rooms were good value and we were impressed by the hotel, our best stay in amsterdam yet!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price but could be much better”
Reviews.Author: frenchie_in_london
Reviews.Content: Me, my boyfriend and 3 other friends have booked this hotel for the weekend. On the internet, they say that it is a short walk to the center, well its not ! Unless you are an olympic champion of marathon, it will take you a hour to walk to centraal station, so unless you got plenty time, you got to take the tram, which I got to admit is pretty easy to get (number 2 is round the corner from the hotel). The double room was allright, but there was way not enough plugs, we had to unplugg the tv to charge our phone or use the straigtener. They provide a hairdryer in each double room but I do recommend to bring your own unless you have very short hair !! They shouldnt call a bathroom but more a washing room, after a shower, the room get flooded and you need to wear wellies to use the sink or toilet. But I do have a few positive things to say, the bed is one of the most comfy i have never had and we had a lovely terrace where we could sit and have a ciggie. We were on the ground floor and feared that it would be too noisy but overall it was quiet. I got to admit that the location is quiet and its near Vondelpark so perfect for a nice walk, but I wont choose this hotel again when I will go back to the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “rundown, unfriendly, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: moose123Uk
Reviews.Content: A hotel I cannot recommend. overpriced and the rooms were rundown and dusty. But the worst was the breakfast: by far too few tables and dishes / flatware for the guests on a weekend morning (when most people would like to have breakfast around 9-9.30am), so one had to wait in line for quite some time for a table. there was only one service personnell at hand and she was clearly overwhelmed. since there were too few dishes, she quickly rinsed dirty ones by hand in washbowl and wiped them off with a damp towel. we felt like in a youth hostel for a hefty price tag.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever”
Reviews.Author: fran07Belgium
Reviews.Content: Poor location ( missleading on web site), dirty, lacking of the most essential confort, overpriced and charging a 2 % extra on credit card payment. Elder and phisically unfit people should also avoid it because of vertical stairs. Worst possible choice in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: tom_mar123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 15th to the 18th of June 2007. I quite liked the location so easy to get to the leidseplein and central station via the number 2 tram stop being almost outside. Also an easy walk through the Vondal Park to leidseplein though a bit of a trek if you want to walk to central or dam square but do-able. The rooms were fine a bit small and not much storage but clean and perfectly comfortable. Some of the reception staff were a bit miserable but nothing too bad. Managed to get up for breakfast twice which was ok but a bit basic. Overall a great base to explore Amsterdam in a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and unhelpful staff - this place should be avoided”
Reviews.Author: jonsieUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although well located, was one of the worse that I have stayed in. This is purely because the staff were unfriendly and unhelpful to me, my friends and to other guests. They created an unwelcoming atmosphere and made you feel as if you were bothering them by asking simple questions like 'how do I get to...'.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: katesafar
Reviews.Content: My best mate and I booked this hotel on a whim (as I recall, we just really enjoyed the name of it!) Because the price of the hotel was so cheap (A double bed for two people - breakfast included) we were pretty sure it would be a dump. But it was HEAVEN! We arrived SO late in the evening (around 1am) and we sheepishly rang the doorbell, only to be escorted inside by a very nice attendant who showed us to our room. The bed was the best thing about this place I must admit. SO COMFORTABLE. Everything was spotless and clean, and there was good water pressure in the shower. The stairs up to our room were tiny and hard to climb - but it was all part of the fun. We never woke up in time for breakfast (we stayed for 4 nights) but it always smelled quite nice. Some are saying this hotel is a bit far out from the typical Amsterdam attractions, and yes it's true, but my mate and I must have not noticed due to the amazing walk we had into the main part of town. Go down the side streets! There's lovely shops and regular Amsterdamian-life happening there far from the touristy places. Also, there's a super dodgy looking food shop a couple streets down from the hotel. If you do happen to try the traditional Amsterdam "legalized stuff", this dodgy store is open late and makes the perfect fish n' chip cure for your intense hunger pangs. The hotel is also quite close to the Van Gough museum and also an amazing park - so enjoy these places! To get to the hotel from the train station is not so tricky once you figure it out. The hotel website tells you what street car to take to get to the hotel and it's perfectly right (and cheap!) Enjoy your stay in Amsterdam! We sure did! -Kate.

Reviews.Title: “clean and sufficent”
Reviews.Author: daytona675
Reviews.Content: small clean tidy hotel ,staff some friendly ,breakfast good when gets going if a little slow to start if you have a early getaway you have to speed them up a bit. taxi service booked from here to the airport was excellent ,as being pushed for time the driver knew which terminal to fly from saved us a lot of time.dont ask for an early morning call to wake you ours never happened,unless phone out of order.i would stop here again .

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettertas
Reviews.Content: VERY central - just catch the tram to the left and down 50m from the front door. Most of the front staff were friendly. Breakfast good for what you get in this price braket and in a nice room. Just make sure you request a room with a shower and toilet if you dont want to share. The only let down was the room decor which was a bit old and lack of sufficent reading lightening at night. We reccommend the place if you just need a clean bed and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel if a little far out!”
Reviews.Author: SELBYLOU
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a website and managed to get a bargain price of a room for myself and 5 others! Upon arriving in Amsterdam we got the number 2 tram from Central station (the number 2 tram can be picked up from nearly everywhere in Amsterdam centre, just look for the number on the tram stops to find out if it stops at the stop), we paid a one off fee of 1.60 euros which is valid for as many journeys as you can make within the hour. The tram ride from central station was about a 12/15 min journey and about 7/10 mins from the Leidesplien area which was what we wanted to be near. To walk to central station it would probably take you well over 1hour and to walk to Leidesplien it would probably take you about 20/25 mins. Upon arriving at the hotel (the tram stop is either at the end of the street or the middle of the street - the street name is announced on the tram so you know where to get off) we checked in with a helpful member of staff, as we were 2 hours early for check in only one room was available, but the staff member was most helpful and allowed us to store our luggage in this one room till our other rooms were available after 1400hrs. All the rooms were twin beds, which is a little annoying if you want to snuggle up to your partner, but then good if you have had a row!!! The rooms we had were all similar but different in size. Room 1 was a very good size with a big bathroom and the worlds biggest mirror, room 2 was a reasonable size with an odd layout and reasonable bathroom and room 3 was the smallest of the rooms with a small bathroom, although adequate. The rooms were basically decorated and a little dated, but all was clean so it wasnt an issue. The mattress was very soft which isnt too good for the back but I slept ok so it wasnt too much of an issue. The bathroom in room 3 smelt a little but soon went away. Sadly noone got to sample the breakfast as noone got out of bed so sadly I cant comment on if it was any good or not. Some of the friends I went with purchased some food and drinks from the fridge at reception, the prices were very expensive, but I think this is standard in Amsterdam as everywhere food and drink is rather expensive which isnt good! Overall the stay at the Apple Inn was good, its situated quite out of the way in a quiet street so ideal for those who want a good nights sleep but not if you want to be in staggering distance from the pubs and clubs in Leidesplien area! If you want to be in staggering distance I wouldnt recommend staying here but somewhere closer. I would stay at the Applie Inn again as it was fantastic value for money, only 59 euros per room which is very cheap and I would recommend to others too if they want a nice quiet stay. We did have a walk when we got there and its within about 15mins walk to the RIKJS (maybe spelt wrong) and the Van Gough museums so ideal location for these places. Amsterdam was very rainy whilst we were there but we still had a fun time. All I would say is make sure you take plenty of money as the food and drink is fairly expensive, you are talking just less than 10 euros for a decent breakky (try the Irish Bar in Liedesplien) and 5 euros for a pint of strongbow!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for short break!”
Reviews.Author: B777-300
Reviews.Content: Nice simple hotel in Amsterdam and perfect for a short break. Not ideal for anyone wanting to be in the thick of the Amsterdam action but ideal for those looking for a hotel in a quiet area and not too far from the center. ideally situated on the No2 tram line. There are 2 tram stops near the hotel (can't tell you which one is nearest). Not that far from the Van Gogh musem and the hotel is on a very nice street. The hotel room we had was quite small but quite adequete for a couple for a few nights. Daily breakfast that finished at 9.30am when we stayed. Included tea, coffee, orange juice (watered!) , apple juice, bread, jams, cheese and sliced meats. Stair case a little steep to some of the rooms which could be difficult for someone with walking difficulties. Overall a very pleasant stay. Nothing luxurious but perfect for a quiet nights sleep after a hectic day touring Amsterdam (Although tram noise can be heard from front bedrooms if you are a light sleeper). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Price Very Good”
Reviews.Author: librasmile05
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the internet prior to departure. Found it a little difficult to get to, as neither the hotel, nor the website we booked it thru gave us much of a clue, but I suspect if you're good at reading maps you'll not find it a problem. Basically, once you get out of the train station, its in a North East direction. We paid about 14 euro's in a taxi from the Dam Square and once we got to the hotel, we realised that it was right outside the number 2 tram stop. So if you get to the Dam Square or indeed outside the central station, you need the number 2 tram and it will drop you off practically outside the hotel. The trams are 1.60 euro's per journey, but are valid for an hour. So you can jump on as many trams as you want within an hour for the same price. The hotel itself is really clean and tidy, the rooms are to a nice standard and we found the reception staff really helpful, especially when our bags were not put on the flight and they spoke to the handling agents in dutch. All in all, well worth the money, and if we went again, I'd gp back without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “red light district - wow”
Reviews.Author: Brigantine
Reviews.Content: Well, before we went I read the reviews and they were either good or bad! I was dreading going to be fair as the bad reviews were bad! We got there and the reception was quite modern, and unlike some reviews I read, the receptionist was polite, and ended up very helpful. Cut a long story short - i snapped the key in my suitcase lock and she directed us to a shoe maker who mamanged to cut off the lock off - nitemare!! Our room was basic, but clean, No ripped bed linen as I had read, and the towels werent smelly either - another thing I read. Our toilet seat was broke which we reported on the Saturday and a new one was fitted on the Monday. It was the weekend they couldnt get a workman out - fair enough. Clean towels daily. Ensuite small, but clean and did the job! Breakfast was fine, toast, cereal, meats and cheese. No full english - but helped with the figure! Haha! All in all the Apple Inn hotel was fine and not as scary as I had read!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Saphy27
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and well placed hotel. The staff were friendly, the room was pleasant and reasonably sized, with sheets changed daily. The breakfast was a normal continental sort, certainly nice and filling to start the day off. The hotel is situated almost next to Vondel Park which is lovely to walk through in the morning - although all the joggers do make you feel unfit! I wouldn't venture there at night however. The hotel is also a short walk away from the Rijks and Van Gogh Museums - if you fancy being cultural. We walked into Amsterdam centre twice a day for 3 days so it's really handy (about 1 mile), but if you;re feeling lazy the trams run regularly right outside the hotel door. There is also a shuttle bus that can take you to and from Schipol Airport for 12euros per person. It's called Connexions and you can buy tickets at the Airport Connexions Booth and the Hotel Reception - very handy! So, if you're a couple or family I would recommend this. The stairs are steep for anyone infirm so this might not be such a good idea, but other than that it would make for a good, reasonably priced place to stay for anyone really. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal Service”
Reviews.Author: Rufus88
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival staff made no effort to greet us or to offer us information on travelling into the city. We were offered no help with our luggage (stairs are extremely narrow and awkward). We were also charged 'city tax' despite the fact that our reservation confirmed that all taxes were included. The hotel staff seem to be impersonal and indifferent. Our first room was damp and musty and we had to insist on being moved to another room. Beware of the adverts which state the Apple Inn is 'child friendly'. I think this means the hotel aren't concerned about groups of students etc making noise and slamming doors until the early hours and disturbing other guests ! If you like to stay in a hotel with a distinctly impersonal service then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBrooks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a very comfortable stay at the Apple Inn. We had a lovely light, airy, big room at the back of the house with a double bed and private terrace overlooking the inner garden. The room was very clean, towels were changed daily. The location is excellent - only five minutes walk to the famous Vondel park. The hotel is on a busy road but we didnâ€™t find the noise interrupted our sleep! Breakfast was tasty and nice, though it was just a self-service buffet. We had a wonderful stay - the hosts were very friendly and helpful! Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, I would heartily recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SigPedersen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Apple Inn Hotel recently (mid Aug 06) and would recommend it highly. Staff were very friendly and helpful, room was fairly spacious, clean and comfortable with all the amenities one would want, only safe deposit box was available on request. The hotel is well situated, close to tram line #2 and within walking distance of many main attractions. The owners of the hotel are delightful and are extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was pretty large and simple with very large windows that let in a beautiful breeze. The breakfast room is very pretty and the breakfast was very good. We hated to leave this hotel after 5 great nights. Family Pedersen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: VickiWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: After reading all the other reviews on this hotel it is fair to say that my friends and I were not looking forward to our break at all. We were in a family room for 4 which after looking at the photos on the hotel website, it looked like we were all going to be in one HUGE bed. Happily, we all had our own single beds, with enough space between them for a bedside cabinet. The hotel is clean, contrary to the other reviews, the bedding was also very clean and maids visited the room every day to clean the bathroom, replenish the stock of loo roll and make the beds. The street can be a bit noisy - there is a tram line outside after all. There isn't a kettle in the room but we took our own anyway so this wasn't a major problem, the breakfasts were basic - breads, jams, muesli and fresh eggs, coffee, tea and fruit juice, but enough to fill you up in a morning. The staircase to the second floor is a bit steep but this seems to be the standard for the whole of Holland, not just this hotel! All in all, I would definitely return to this hotel and would not believe a word of the previous reviews, these people were obviously nit picking as I have never stayed in 2 star accomodation before but was pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel is.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Apple Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Koninginneweg 93, Amsterdam 1075 CJ, The Netherlands
